title: Keris partisan

properties.value: The keris partisan is a one-handed melee weapon requiring 65 Attack to wield. It is obtained from Maisa as a reward for completing the quest Beneath Cursed Sands. If lost, it can be reclaimed from Selim for 60,000 coins.

Keris partisan

Item ID25979

The keris partisan is a one-handed melee weapon requiring 65 Attack to wield. It is obtained from Maisa as a reward for completing the quest Beneath Cursed Sands. If lost, it can be reclaimed from Selim for 60,000 coins.

The keris partisan retains the effects of the keris, dealing 33% bonus damage against all Kalphites and Scabarites, alongside a 1/51 chance of puncturing a hole in their exoskeleton, dealing triple damage. When this special effect occurs, the chatbox will display the message: You slip your weapon through a chink in the creature's chitin, landing a vicious blow. Unlike the keris, however, the partisan provides a secondary crush bonus.

The keris partisan cannot be poisoned with any form of weapon poison, unlike the standard keris.

Combat styles[edit | edit source]

Category: PartisanCombat StyleStyle typeWeapon StyleExperienceInvisible Boost
StabStabAccurateAttack and Hitpoints+3 Attack
LungeStabAggressiveStrength and Hitpoints+3 Strength
PoundCrushAggressiveStrength and Hitpoints+3 Strength
BlockStabDefensiveDefence and Hitpoints+3 Defence

Upgrading[edit | edit source]

When the Tombs of Amascut is released, players will be able to attach three different jewels, obtained as rewards from the raid, to the keris partisan, giving it differing effects; this increases the requirement to wield them to 80 Attack.

  • Eye of the Corrupter - Adds a damage-over-time effect to attacked enemies. Players won't be able to stack this effect multiple times onto a single NPC, but will be able to apply it to multiple NPCs at once. Only usable within Tombs of Amascut.
  • Jewel of the Sun - Applies a debuff to attacked NPCs, which causes them to take higher damage for a sustained period of time. Only usable within Tombs of Amascut.
  • Breach of the Scarab - Adds a 33% accuracy bonus against Kalphites and Scabarites. Usable everywhere, not just in Tombs of Amascut.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
4 May 2022
(update)

The keris partisan's slash attack bonus has been decreased from +58 to -2, as it does not have a slash combat style.

[[File:Keris partisan detail.png|left|130px]]
The '''keris partisan''' is a one-handed melee weapon requiring 65 [[Attack]] to wield. It is obtained from [[Maisa]] as a reward for completing the [[quest]] [[Beneath Cursed Sands]]. If lost, it can be reclaimed from [[Selim]] for 60,000 [[coins]]. 

The keris partisan retains the effects of the [[keris]], dealing 33% bonus damage against all [[Kalphites]] and [[Scabarites]], alongside a 1/51 chance of puncturing a hole in their exoskeleton, dealing triple damage. When this special effect occurs, the chatbox will display the message: {{RSFont|You slip your weapon through a chink in the creature's chitin, landing a vicious blow.}} Unlike the keris, however, the partisan provides a secondary crush bonus. 

The keris partisan cannot be [[poison]]ed with any form of [[weapon poison (disambiguation)|weapon poison]], unlike the standard [[keris]].

==Combat styles==
{{CombatStyles|Partisan}}

==Upgrading==
When the [[Tombs of Amascut]] is released, players will be able to attach three different jewels, obtained as rewards from the raid, to the keris partisan, giving it differing effects; this increases the requirement to wield them to 80 [[Attack]].
* '''Eye of the Corrupter''' -  Adds a damage-over-time effect to attacked enemies. Players won't be able to stack this effect multiple times onto a single NPC, but will be able to apply it to multiple NPCs at once. Only usable within Tombs of Amascut.
* '''Jewel of the Sun''' - Applies a debuff to attacked NPCs, which causes them to take higher damage for a sustained period of time. Only usable within Tombs of Amascut.
* '''Breach of the Scarab''' - Adds a 33% accuracy bonus against [[Kalphites]] and [[Scabarites]]. Usable everywhere, not just in Tombs of Amascut.
